intro: Cylindropus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. These plants are characterized by their simple, often cylindrical stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. They typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. The leaves are usually alternate and may have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Cylindropus species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, and some species are used in traditional medicine.
